hypothesis_content.title: ETH/BTC Ratio Recovery on BTC Stress Events
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC drops sharply (≥5%) on macro news in a NEUTRAL/BEAR regime, ETH/BTC ratio will initially dip but recover faster than BTC price itself over the next 24-48 hours, as ETH's lower leverage ratio and stronger staking yield anchor provide relative resilience.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Current BTC drop is linked to macro fears, not crypto-specific issues. ETH's structural staking yield (~3-4%) provides a relative floor vs. BTC during risk-off events that are not ETH-specific. The funding rate condition ensures the pressure is more concentrated in BTC derivatives.
entry_conditions: BTC 4hr close down ≥5% on macro news
BTC estimated futures funding rate turns negative (< -0.01%)
ETH perpetual funding rate remains > BTC funding rate

exit_conditions.take_profit: ETH/BTC ratio returns to its 20-day moving average
exit_conditions.stop_loss: ETH/BTC ratio makes new 4hr low (further weakness)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: ETH/BTC ratio continues to decline alongside BTC, failing to show any relative strength within 24 hours.
